WT_BOOT_MSG: The Win-Test telegram bot is now active!
WT_SHUTDOWN_MSG: The Win-Test telegram bot is shutting down...
WT_ENCODING_ERROR:
Sorry, I couldn't pass that message to Win-Test üòï

Please only use letters from the extended latin alphabet. That's for both your message as well as for your Win-Tes display name. (That excludes also emojis)
WT_MSG_LONG_ERROR:
Sorry, I couldn't pass that message to Win-Test üòï

Win-Test message have a maximum length of [charlimit] characters!
WT_STN_LONG_ERROR:
Sorry, I couldn't pass that message to Win-Test üòï

Your Win-Test display name ([stnname]) is too long. The maximum length is [charlimit] characters!
UNKNOWN_ERROR: An unexpected error arose. Please contact your Bot-Manager.
REQUEST_WTNAME:
Hi [name]!

It seems you have not set a Win-Test display name. Please to so, that operators can identify the sender. Use the /name command for that.
RESTART_VALID: I am already started and ready to go in this chat! Use /help to show additional info.
RESTART_UNVALID:
I am already started in this chat. However, this chat is not activated. Please respond with /verify [SECRET KEY] to activate this chat. 

You will get the secret key from this bot's manager.
WELCOME_PRIVATE:
Hi [name]!
Nice to meet you! I am a Telegram bot which builds a bridge between Win-Test's chat and telegram. With me, you can receive and send chat messages from and to Win-Test during a contest!

To get started, you'll need to verify yourself. In order to so so, please use /verify [SECRET_KEY]
You will get the secret key from your bot manager.
WELCOME_GROUP:
Hi everyone!
I am a Telegram bot which builds a bridge between Win-Test's chat and telegram. With me, you can receive and send chat messages from and to Win-Test during a contest!

To get started, you'll need to verify this chat. In order to so so, please use /verify [SECRET_KEY]
You will get the secret key from your bot manager.
UNKNOWN_CHAT_ERROR: Oops, it seems I have no data about this conversation. Please start a conversation using /start.
INVALID_VERIFY_SYNTAX:
The correct syntax for this command is:
/verify [SECRET KEY]
Please try again.
VERIFY_SUCCESS_PRIVATE:
Verification successfull!

From now on, new Win-Test chat messages will appear here. In order to send a message to Win-Test, just write a message in this chat. 
For additional commands, see /help

I suggest you set your Win-Test display name. If you set it equal to your callsign you use to OPON into Win-Test, I can identify you as operator and not send your own messages into this chat.
VERIFY_SUCCESS_GROUP:
Verification successfull!

I will relay Win-Test messages into this goup chat. In order to send messages to Win-Test, start your message with @[botuname].

Everyone of you can set a Win-Test display name using /name
This allows the operators to identify the author of the messages. If you plan to operate, set this name to your Win-Test OPON callsign.
VERIFY_FAILED: Sorry that key was not correct. Please try again. Make sure you don't accidentally send spaces in the message.
NOT_VALID_ERROR: Sorry, this chat is not verified. Please do so via the /verify [SECRET_KEY] command.
NAME_SET_USERNAME:
Thanks for setting your Win-Test diplay name. As you have not spcified one, I've used your Telegram username [uname].
Feel free to change it again by using /name [NAME]
NAME_SYNTAX_UNAME:
Sorry, the correct syntax for this command is /name [NAME]
I've tried to use your Telegram username [uname], but that failed. There is a character limit of [charlim] characters.
NAME_SET_SUCCESS: Great thanks. Your messages will look in Win-Test as originating from [dispname].
NAME_SET_FAILED: Sorry that did not work. There is a character limit of [charlim] characters. Please try again.
LANG_SYNTAX:
Sorry, that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /lang [LANGUAGE_CODE]
Where [LANGUAGE_CODE] is one of the following languages:
[languages]
LANG_SUCCESS: Ok, from now on, I will communicate in english with you.
LANG_NOT_FOUND:
Sorry, that did not work.
The language you stated is not installed.
The correct syntax for this command is /lang [LANGUAGE_CODE]
Where [LANGUAGE_CODE] is one of the following languages:
[languages]
MUTE_SYNTAX_PRV:
Sorry, that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /mute [all|own|none]
-all: Disables all messages to this chat
-own: If you're logged in as OP in Win-Test this chat is muted
-none: All messages at all times are displayed here
MUTE_SYNTAX_GRP:
Sorry, that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /mute [all|none]
-all: Disables all messages to this chat
-none: All messages at all times are displayed here
MUTE_OWN_PRV: This chat will only receive messages, if you're NOT logged in as OP in Win-Test
MUTE_OWN_GRP: This option is not available in group chats.
CONFIRM_SYNTAX:
Sorry, that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /confirm [on|off]
-on: Enables a confirmation message, indicating your message arrived at Win-Test
-off: Disables the confirmation message
ALL_SYNTAX:
Sorry, that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /all [on|off]
-on: Relays, besides Win-Test Messages, Telegram messages from other users sent to Win-Test
-off: Only relays Win-Test messages into this chat
ALL_ON: Messages originating from Win-Test and Telegram are displayed here.
ALL_OFF: Only messages from Win-Test are displayed here.
SUDO_GROUP: This command is not available in group chats.
SUDO_SYNTAX:
Sorry, that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /sudo [SUPERUSER_PASSWORD]
SUDO_FAILED: Sorry, wrong password. Please try again.
ONLY_SUPERUSER_GRP: This command is only available to super-users in privat chats.
ONLY_SUPERUSER_PRV: This command is only available to super-users.
DUMP_USER_PRV:
User: [user]
		Display name: [wt_dispname]
		Log level: [log_level]
		Super-User: [is_superuser]
		This user has a privat chat with me:
				Languagecode: [langcode]
				Verified: [valid]
				Mute mode: [mute]
				Win-Test confirmation: [wt_confirm]
				All Messages: [tg_to_tg]
DUMP_USER:
User: [user]
		Display name: [wt_dispname]
		Log level: [log_level]
		Super-User: [is_superuser]
DUMP_GRPchat:
Group: [groupname]
		Languagecode: [langcode]
		Verified: [valid]
		Mute-Mode: [mute]
		Win-Test confirmation: [wt_confirm]
		All messages: [tg_to_tg]
MAKELEAVE_SYNTAX:
Sorry, that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /makeleave [USER|GROUP]
Where USER/GROUP is the user/group name you want to remove. You can see all users and groups via /dump
MAKELEAVE_NOT_FOUND:
Sorry, I don't know the name you stated.
The correct syntax for this command is /makeleave [USER|GROUP]
Where USER/GROUP is the user/group name you want to remove. You can see all users and groups via /dump
TO_PLEBS: Your super-user rights have been revoked.
HELP_GRP:
Help

I am the bridge between Win-Test's Chat and Telegram. Any Win-Test messages will be forwarded into this group chat. In order to send a message to Win-Test, just start your message with @[botuname].

A list of possible commands:
/name [NAME] - Sets your station name in Win-Test (Currently: [wt_dispname] (It's different for every group member!))
/lang [LANGCODE] - Selects my language. Possible languages: [languages]/mute [all|none] - Mute (all) or unmute (none) this chat (Currently: [mute])
/confirm [on|off] - Switches a Win-Test confirmation on or off (Currently: [wt_confirm])
/all [on|off] - Selects, weather messages from other Telegram chats with me are also forwarded into this chat (Currently: [tg_to_tg])
/leave - Deletes all data about this chat WITHOUT asking for confirmation
/help - Displays this help message
HELP_SUSER:
Help

I am the bridge between Win-Test's Chat and Telegram. Any Win-Test messages will be forwarded into this chat. In order to send a message to Win-Test, just type it here.

A list of possible commands for you as super-user:
/name [NAME] -Sets your station name in Win-Test (Currently: [wt_dispname])
/lang [LANGCODE] - Selects my language. Possible languages: [languages]/mute [all|own|none] - Mute (all) or unmute (none) this chat. 'own' mutes this chat only if you're logged-in into Win-Test (Currently: [mute])
/confirm [on|off] - Switches a Win-Test confirmation on or off (Currently: [wt_confirm])
/all [on|off] - Selects, weather messages from other Telegram chats with me are also forwarded into this chat (Currently: [tg_to_tg])
/leave - Deletes all data about this chat WITHOUT asking for confirmation
/dump - Displays all stored data
/makeleave [USER/GROUP] - Deletes the given user/chat WITHOUT asking for confirmation. The deleted chat is not notified.
/loglevel [none|debug|info|warn|error|fatal] - Forwards bot-server logs of the given level into this chat (Currently: [log_level])
/plebs - Revokes your super-suer rights WITHOUT asking for confirmation
/help - Displays this help message
HELP_PRV:
Help

I am the bridge between Win-Test's Chat and Telegram. Any Win-Test messages will be forwarded into this chat. In order to send a message to Win-Test, just type it here.

A list of possible commands:
/name [NAME] -Sets your station name in Win-Test (Currently: [wt_dispname])
/lang [LANGCODE] - Selects my language. Possible languages: [languages]/mute [all|own|none] - Mute (all) or unmute (none) this chat. 'own' mutes this chat only if you're logged-in into Win-Test (Currently: [mute])
/confirm [on|off] - Switches a Win-Test confirmation on or off (Currently: [wt_confirm])
/all [on|off] - Selects, weather messages from other Telegram chats with me are also forwarded into this chat (Currently: [tg_to_tg])
/leave - Deletes all data about this chat WITHOUT asking for confirmation
/sudo [PASSWORT] - Grants you super-user rights
/help - Displays this help message
LOGLEVEL_SYNTAX:
Sorry that did not work.
The correct syntax for this command is /loglevel [none|debug|info|warn|error|fatal]
LOGLEVEL_SUCCESS: Your new logging level has been set.
